Journalists in the West Bank face mounting suppression
subhead: Since October 7, Israel has arrested and imprisoned at least 140 journalists working in this occupied territory, most often under the catch-all charge of 'incitement to terrorism.' subhead: The US Treasury issued new sanctions on Brazilian Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes, known for his role in the trial of Brazil's former far-right leader, Jair Bolsonaro, and his order to shut down X in 2024.

title: UNICEF France calls for protecting underage victims of criminal exploitation rather than punishment
subhead: In a new report, the French branch of the UN agency highlights the lack of resources for identifying and protecting minors who are victims of criminal exploitation. It makes 75 recommendations for public authorities.

title: No progress made on France's terrorism memorial despite years of studies
subhead: French President Emmanuel Macron reaffirmed his commitment in January to see the site inaugurated after years of back-and-forth in the planning process. But the funding has not been secured.

subhead: 'Being 20 in West Berlin' (2/6). In the late 1970s, Karin Wieland fled her small German town to live communally in an abandoned building in Kreuzberg, throwing herself into every cause of the era.

title: Letters from prisoners held in solitary confinement: 'I feel like becoming violent again'

title: Suing the state in France: How does this universal right work in practice?
subhead: Climate, health, femicides: Lawsuits against the state have surged in recent years. Beyond securing compensation for victims, these legal procedures primarily aim to raise public awareness and drive change.
